intro: Conomorpha macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf conomorpha, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. It produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for its potential medicinal properties.
